result.execSummary:
The defendant Chase E. Sandmire was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Stayed until on or before September 15, 2019 with permission to transfer that sentence to Dane County. Sentence is with huber or electronic monitoring if deemed appropriate by the Dane County Sheriff. 10 days credit ordered by the Court. Court costs waived. DNA sample must be submitted to the Richland County Sheriff's Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

03:45 PM Defendant Chase E. Sandmire in court with attorney David E Saperstein. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Motion hearing in 15CF29 on State's motion to revoke DPA and plea/sentencing in 18CF101 and 18CF115. Defense does not oppose the motion to revoke the DPA. Atty. Saperstein states the parties' agreement for resolution of all 3 maters. In 18CF101, count 1 will be amended to misd. bail jumping; likewise with count 1 in 18CF115; in those cases, agreed-upon dispo calls for costs only. In 15CF29, agreement calls for 60 days jail - may be transferred to Dane County on huber sentence or EM if deemed appropriate. Court sentences as requested: 15CF29 - 60 days jail with huber, stayed for 60 days until on or before 9/15 with permission to transfer that sentence to Dane County; may serve huber or on EM if deemed appropriate. 18CF101 and 18CF115 - costs only. 60 days to pay. Felony admonishment provided in 15CF29. 4 days credit in 15CF29. 3 days credit on each 18CF101 and 18CF115. (Court directs clerk to put 10 days credit all on 15CF29).
Motion hearing on July 17, 2019 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: (Ordered 8/21/15 - cash bond amended to signature bond - same conditions - posted cash to be refunded upon signature on this bond by the defendant.)
from CS to Judge and reply.

Several cases called together:  15CF26/adjourned initial, 15CF29/adjourned initial, 15CM59/status, and status in 15TR447-449.  Defendant Chase E. Sandmire in court with attorney Peter K. Lawrence. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA Harper states that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution of all matters; states the agreement for the record.

Prelims waived in 15CF26 and 15CF29.  Informations filed in both cases.  Court's colloquy on prelim waivers on both cases.  Def pleads no contest to counts 1 and 2 of 15CF26 and count 1 of 15CF29, those three charges being the only charges carried over in the information from the original complaints.  DA has asked for DPA of 4 years in 15CF29 and probation with restitution and other conditions in 15CF26; other cases to be dismissed or dismissed/read in.  Court finds defendant guilty in all pleaded to counts.  Sentence ordered withheld in 15CF29 for the 4 yr DPA.

DA address Court on proposed sentence in 15CF26:  Count 1 - 120 day jail sentence.  For both counts, DA asks for probation to include absolute sobriety, anger management, and all assts and treatment as recommended by agent.  Also, no contact with RCHS.  Additionally, both as probation condition and condition of DPA, def not to gun or bow hunt in any shape or form including animal or bird, no trapping of any kind, no fishing of any kind, no applying for a license for any of those activities under Chapter 29, and no accompanying anyone participating in those activities.  Other Chapter 29 privileges, those not already stated, are allowed.  If the Defendant is able to successfully complete probation, counsel are asking for expungement as def has no prior criminal record.  Atty. Lawrence addresses the Court.

Court rules on sentence:

15CF26
Def placed on 4 years probation with conditions - 120 days on count 1, with start date at the discretion of the agent (agent should not require him to serve it til November); work release privileges on the jail; maintain absolute sobriety; no possess/consumption of alcohol; evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine to monitor; anger management; take any other treatment/assts ordered by agent; no contact with RCHS; no gun or bow hunting; no trapping; no fishing; no applying for DNR license; no accompanying people doing those activities.  Expungement to be allowed per 973.015 upon successful completion of probation.  Costs.

DA has requested restitution of $942.36 to RCHS.  Atty. Lawrence asks for opportunity to review that request.  Court gives DA 15 days to disclose and defense 15 days to respond.

15CF29
Diversion agreement approved and ordered for 4 years.  Court amends bond to signature and orders cash bond released to the poster.

Felony firearm and other felony admonishments provided.  DNA sampling ordered at the Richland County Sheriff's Department before signing up for probation.
